page.title: 09JAWBONES HILL
page.content: Near the water tower we saw a little gate,there were long greenhouses lined up in the field.The greenhouse we went in smelt of warm,sour tomatoes,the two ladies who were working in the rows of tomato plants said they were picking off the side shoots.There was an odd tall,thin barn on the same path,where a Dartmouth fisherman stores his crab pots and gear.Further down the lane we climbed the bank and could see:-the Dart up as far as Maypool,Dartmoor, Torbay,Townstal and a lot of the town.At the sharp bend of Jawbones there are steep allotments overlooking the estuary.The gardeners on one plot grow strawberries,raspberries,lettuce, blackcurrants,herbs,onions,potatoes and gooseberries (not carrots because of forkroot).Rabbits,magpies and pigeons come over from the woods so they have to grow enough for them too.
